intro: Adenandra cistoides, commonly known as the rock fig, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces distinctive, yellowish-orange flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds. Adenandra cistoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
